Chapter 3, Part 2: The Wheel-Turning King
What kind of jade woman treasure does the wheel-turning king have?

In the morning, when the wheel-turning king sits with his ministers to discuss matters, a natural jade woman treasure appears before him, upright and beautiful, with a complexion beyond compare, neither tall nor short, neither fat nor thin, neither white nor black.

In winter, her body is warm, and in summer, it is cool. The pores of her body all emit the fragrance of sandalwood, and her mouth emits the fragrance of lotus flowers. The wheel-turning king cherishes her deeply, and his mind does not give rise to lustful thoughts towards others, let alone physical action.
At that time, the wheel-turning king is overjoyed and exclaims:
The jade woman treasure has already appeared to me naturally. Now I have become a wheel-turning king.
The wheel-turning king's jade woman treasure is like this.
What is the nature of the wheel-turning king's precious minister of treasures?

When the wheel-turning king sits in court at dawn, he sees the precious minister of treasures in front of him, understanding affairs with wisdom and sincerity, who goes to the wheel-turning king and says:
Whatever the wheel-turning king wishes to seek, I will provide for the heavenly king, and the king need only sit in peace.
The wheel-turning king wishes to test the precious minister of treasures, so he gathers the four divisions of troops, boards a ship and enters the water, and tells the precious minister of treasures:
I wish to obtain gold, silver, and precious treasures, please give them to me.
The precious minister of treasures says to the wheel-turning king:
After crossing the water, I will give whatever the king wishes.
The king says:
I will use them here now, quickly give me gold, silver, and precious treasures. After crossing the water, I will not use them.

The chief minister of the treasury heard and accepted his instructions, adjusted his robes, knelt on the ship with his right hand stirring the water, and scooped up gold, silver, and precious treasures with a vessel.
It was like insects attaching to a tree, and the gold, silver, and precious treasures attached to his hand in the same way.
At that time, the chief minister of the treasury held the various treasures on the ship and said to the wheel-turning king:
How much gold, silver, and precious treasures do you wish to obtain?
I will now give them to you.
The wheel-turning king said to the chief minister of the treasury:
I have a great many gold, silver, and precious treasures, but I just wanted to test you.
Having heard this, the chief minister of the treasury then returned the gold, silver, and precious treasures to the water.
At that time, the wheel-turning king was overjoyed and said:
The treasure of the chief minister of the treasury has spontaneously appeared for me, and I have now become a wheel-turning king.
The wheel-turning king possesses the treasure of the chief minister of the treasury like this.
What kind is the military advisor treasure of the wheel-turning king?
When the wheel-turning king sits in court at dawn, he sees a military advisor in front of him, who is wise, brave, and understands affairs. He goes to the wheel-turning king and says:
Whatever you wish to do, I will take care of it. You need only sit at ease and do not worry!
At that time, the wheel-turning king wants to test the military advisor and orders the four divisions of the army to assemble, telling the military advisor treasure:

Teach those who do not understand military strategy to understand it, those who already understand it to know it thoroughly, those who do not understand how to stay to know how to stay, and those who do not understand how to ride and shoot with a bow and horse to know it.
The military advisor treasure immediately accepts the order and teaches all the soldiers.
The wheel-turning king is very joyful and says:
The military advisor treasure has already appeared for me. I am now a wheel-turning king.
The military advisor treasure of the wheel-turning king is like this.
The Buddha said:
The wheel-turning king has seven treasures like this.
The Buddha said:
The wheel-turning king has four virtues.
What are the four virtues?

First, the wheel-turning king is greatly wealthy, with abundant treasures, fields, houses, servants, pearls, elephants, horses, and skilled craftsmen. No one in the world is as wealthy as the wheel-turning king. This is the first virtue of the wheel-turning king.
Second, the wheel-turning king is supremely handsome and unparalleled in appearance. No one in the world is as handsome as the wheel-turning king. This is the second virtue of the wheel-turning king.

Third, the wheel-turning king is always at ease and free from illness. His body is always in balance, neither cold nor hot, and the cold and heat are just right for him. All the food and drink he consumes is safe and secure. No one in the world is as free from illness as the wheel-turning king. This is the third virtue of the wheel-turning king.
Fourth, the wheel-turning king always enjoys peace and longevity. No one in the world enjoys peace and longevity like the wheel-turning king. This is the fourth virtue of the wheel-turning king.
The wheel-turning king possesses the seven treasures and four virtues like this.
The wheel-turning king governs by righteous Dharma, not by turning to good appearances, and practices the ten wholesome deeds.
He teaches the kings of small countries, his ministers, and the people to practice the ten wholesome deeds.

The wheel-turning king has compassion for the people of all the states, like a father has compassion for his children, and the people of all the states love and respect the wheel-turning king like a child loves his father.

When the wheel-turning king rules the country in the world, it is rich, happy, peaceful, and prosperous, with abundant harvests and a large population.

Those who came from the four directions to pay homage to the wheel-turning king and to practice and build stupas all attained innumerable blessings.

At that time, after the precious jade woman, the precious minister of the treasury, and the precious minister of guidance had built the stupa for the wheel-turning king, they then gave food to the hungry, drink to the thirsty, clothes to those who wanted clothes, fragrant flowers to those who wanted fragrant flowers, and cattle and sheep to those who wanted wealth and property.
Later, the precious jade woman, the precious sage minister in charge of the treasury, and the precious sage minister who guides the way all passed away.
